field.documentation: total parallel current density = average(jtot.B) / B0, where B0 = coreprof/toroid_field/b0 [A/m^2]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: jni
field.documentation: non-inductive parallel current density = average(jni.B) / B0, where B0 = coreprof/toroid_field/b0 [A/m^2]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: jphi
field.documentation: total toroidal current density = average(jphi/R) / average(1/R) [A/m^2]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: joh
field.documentation: ohmic parallel current density = average(joh.B) / B0, where B0 = coreprof/toroid_field/b0 [A/m^2]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: vloop
field.documentation: Toroidal loop voltage [V]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: sigmapar
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity [ohm^-1.m^-1]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: qoh
field.documentation: ohmic heating [W/m^3]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Value of the source term; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: integral
field.documentation: Integral from 0 to rho of the source term. Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: qei
field.documentation: Collisional heat transfer from electrons to ions (equipartition term) [W/m^3]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: eparallel
field.documentation: Parallel electric field = average(E.B) / B0, where B0 = coreprof/toroid_field/b0 [V.m^-1]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: e_b
field.documentation: Average(E.B) [V.T.m^-1]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor profile; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: shear
field.documentation: Magnetic shear profile; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: ns
field.documentation: Density of fast ions, for the various ion species [m^-3]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); Array of strings (nion)

field.name: mtor
field.documentation: Toroidal momentum of the various ion species [UNITS?]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); Array of strings (nion)

field.name: wtor
field.documentation: Angular toroidal rotation frequency of the various ion species [s^-1]; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); Array of strings (nion)

field.name: vpol
field.documentation: Neoclassical poloidal rotation of each ion species [m/s]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); Array of strings (nion)

field.name: zeff
field.documentation: Effective charge profile; Time-dependent;

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: bpol
field.documentation: Average poloidal magnetic field, defined as sqrt(ave(grad rho^2/R^2)).dpsi/drho [T]. Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: dvprimedt
field.documentation: Time derivative of the radial derivative of the volume enclosed in the flux surface, i.e. d/dt(dV/drho_tor) [m^2.s^-1]; Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source of the profile (any comment describing the origin of the profile : code, path to diagnostic signals, massaging, ...); String

field.name: globalparam
field.documentation: Various global quantities calculated from the 1D profiles. Time-dependent

field.name: current_tot
field.documentation: Total plasma current [A]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: current_bnd
field.documentation: Plasma current inside transport solver boundary rho_tor_bnd [A]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: current_ni
field.documentation: Total non-inductive parallel current [A]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: vloop
field.documentation: Toroidal loop voltage [V]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: li
field.documentation: Internal inductance; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: beta_tor
field.documentation: toroidal beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: beta_normal
field.documentation: normalised beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: poloidal beta; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: w_dia
field.documentation: Plasma energy content = 3/2 * int(p,dV) with p being the total pressure (pr_th + pr_perp). Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: geom_axis
field.documentation: RZ position of the geometric axis (defined as (Rmin+Rmax) / 2 and (Zmin+Zmax) / 2 of the boundary) [m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

CPO.documentation: Generic source term for the core transport equations (radial profile). Time-dependent CPO.

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

field.name: id
field.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species). OBSOLESCENT.

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the ions - note the charge state is not included; String Vector (nion)

field.name: desc_impur
field.documentation: Description of the impurities (list of ion species and possibly different charge states). OBSOLESCENT.

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number of the impurity; Vector (nimp)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge of the impurity; Vector (nimp)

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the coreprof ion species ordering. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for each impurity species. Vector (nimp)

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Matrix (nimp,max_nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Matrix (nimp,max_nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the impurities - note that the charge state is not included; String Vector (nimp)

field.name: compositions
field.documentation: Contains all the composition information for the simulation (main ions, impurities, neutrals, edge species).

field.name: nuclei
field.documentation: Array of nuclei considered.

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge [units of elementary charge];

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Mass of atom [amu]

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying element (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Array of main plasma ions.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: impurities
field.documentation: Array of impurities.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the ions array of structures. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: toroid_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field, redundant with the toroidfield CPO, to document the normalisation of rho and j in this CPO.

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Characteristic major radius of the device (used in publications, usually middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane) [m]. Scalar.

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum field at r0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. Scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: values
field.documentation: Description of the source terms of various origins. Array of structure (nsource). Time-dependent.

field.name: sourceid
field.documentation: Identifier for the origin of the source terms (see conventions in the ITM website)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate (not normalised, equivalent to rho_tor_norm) [m]; Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate values (= rho_tor normalised to the value at the last grid point); Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed in the flux surface [m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface [m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: j
field.documentation: Parallel current source for psi transport equation, = average(j.B) / B0, where B0 = coresource/toroid_field/b0 [A.m^-2]. Vector(nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: sigma
field.documentation: Induced parallel conductivity [ohm^-1.m^-1]. EXACT DEFINITION PENDING. Vector(nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: si
field.documentation: Particle source for ion density transport equation [m^-3.s^-1]. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: se
field.documentation: Particle source for electron density transport equation [m^-3.s^-1]. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.name: sz
field.documentation: Particle source for impurity density transport equation [m^-3.s^-1]. Vector(nimpur). Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Array2d (nrho,nzimp)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Array2d (nrho,nzimp)

field.name: qi
field.documentation: Heat source for ion heat transport equations [W.m^-3]. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: qe
field.documentation: Heat source for electron heat transport equation [W.m^-3]. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.name: qz
field.documentation: Heat source for impurity heat transport equations [W.m^-3]. Vector(nimpur). Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Array2d (nrho,nzimp)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Array2d (nrho,nzimp)

field.name: ui
field.documentation: Toroidal torque on individual ion species; for toroidal momentum transport equation [kg.m^-1.s^-2]. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: ujxb
field.documentation: Toroidal JxB torque on bulk plasma; for toroidal momentum transport equation [kg.m^-1.s^-2]. Here J is the return current from fast ion radial currents Jfast=-J. Time-dependent.

field.name: exp
field.documentation: Explicit source term [same unit as root quantity]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.name: imp
field.documentation: Implicit source term [s^-1.m^-3]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho)

field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: values
field.documentation: Description of transport term coming from various origins. Array of structure (ntransp). Time-dependent

field.name: transportid
field.documentation: Identifier for the origin of the transport terms (see conventions in the ITM website)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate values (= rho_tor normalised to the value at the last grid point); Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate (not normalised, equivalent to rho_tor_norm) [m]; Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed in the flux surface [m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface [m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: sigma
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity [ohm^-1.m^-1]. Time-dependent. Vector(nrho).

field.name: ni_transp
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for ion density equation. Time-dependent.

field.name: diff_eff
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity [m^2.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,3)

field.name: vconv_eff
field.documentation: Effective convection [m.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,3)

field.name: flux
field.unit: field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself
field.documentation: Flux. Not used in transport equations [field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: off_diagonal
field.documentation: Details of the transport matrix, just for diagnostic (not used in transport equations). Time-dependent.

field.name: d_ni
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ti
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ne
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_te
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron temperature gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_epar
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling parallel electric field to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_mtor
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling total toroidal momentum to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Flag describing the form of transport produced by the original model : 0- not calculated, 1- D and V, 2- flux, 3- full transport matrix. Scalar.

The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,3)

field.name: vconv_eff

The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,3)

field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

CPO.documentation: Datastructure for representing data associated with a distribution function one or many particle species. This structure is specifically designed to handle non-Maxwellian distribution function generated during heating and current drive, typically solved using a Fokker-Planck calculation perturbed by a heating scheme (e.g. IC, EC, LH, NBI, or alpha heating) and then relaxed by Coloumb collisions. Time-dependent CPO

field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species). OBSOLESCENT.

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the ions - note the charge state is not included; String Vector (nion)

field.name: compositions
field.documentation: Contains all the composition information for the simulation (main ions, impurities, neutrals, edge species).

field.name: nuclei
field.documentation: Array of nuclei considered.

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge [units of elementary charge];

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Mass of atom [amu]

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying element (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Array of main plasma ions.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: impurities
field.documentation: Array of impurities.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the ions array of structures. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: distri_vec
field.documentation: Vector over all distribution functions. Every distribution function has to be associated with only one particle species, specifiec in distri_vec/species/, but there could be multiple distribution function for each species. In this case, the fast particle populations should be superposed. Time-dependent. Structure array(ndistri_vec)

field.name: wave_id
field.documentation: List all waves affecting the distribution, as specified in waves/coherentwave/wave_id (see waves_types in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes). Vector(n_antennas)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify the type of the object or process.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: name
field.documentation: The name of the object or process. Here the object should be an instans of the type specified in the field type.

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index the separating objects or processes with the same name.

field.name: source_id
field.documentation: List all neutral beam injectors and reactions contributing to the source, as specified in distsource/source/source_id (see distsource_types in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes). Vector(n_injectors_and_reactions)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify the type of the object or process.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: name
field.documentation: The name of the object or process. Here the object should be an instans of the type specified in the field type.

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index the separating objects or processes with the same name.

field.name: species
field.documentation: Defines the distribution function species represented in this element of distri_vec. Time-dependent

field.name: type
field.documentation: The type species: type.flag=1 for electron source; type.flag=2 for ion source taken from compositions/ions; type.flag=3 for impurity source taken from compositions/impur; 4=neutron source; 4=photon source etc (see species_reference_identifier_definition in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes).

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index of the species. This definition of index depends on the value of type; if the species is an ion (type.flag=1) or an impurity (type.flag=2) then the index refers to distribution/compositions/ions, or distribution/compositions/impur, respectively. This field has no meaning for other species, e.g. like electrons, neutrons or photons. The indexing follows the Fortran/Matlab convention where the first element in an array has index 1.

field.name: gyro_type
field.documentation: Defines how to interpret the spatial coordinates: 1 = given at the actual particle position; 2 = given at the gyro centre of the particle position. Time-dependent

field.name: fast_filter
field.documentation: Description of how the fast and the thermal particle populations, used in global_param and profiles_1d, were separated.

field.name: method
field.documentation: Identifier describing the method used to separate the fast and thermal particle population (see fast_thermal_separation_filter_identifier_definition in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: energy_sep
field.documentation: Energy at which the fast and thermal particle populations were separated [eV]. Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: Global parameters (in most cases volume integrated and surface averaged quanatities). Time-dependent

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: Geometrical constants

field.name: mag_axis
field.documentation: Position of the magnetic axis [m]. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: toroid_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field. Used to define the radial coordiante rho_tor and to measure the current drive. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Characteristic major radius of the device (used in publications, usually middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane) [m]. Scalar.

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum field at r0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. Scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: state
field.documentation: Algebraic moments of the distribution function integrated over the plasma volume, e.g. total number of particles, energy etc. Time-dependent

field.name: n_particles
field.documentation: Number of particles in the distribution; the volume integral of the density (note: this is the number of real particles and not markers); Time-dependent

field.name: n_part_fast
field.documentation: Number of fast particles in the distribution; the volume integral of the fast particle density (note: this is the number of real particles and not markers); Time-dependent

field.name: enrg
field.documentation: Total energy distribution [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: enrg_fast
field.documentation: Total energy of the fast particle distribution [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: enrg_fast_pa
field.documentation: Parallel energy of the fast particle distribution [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: momentm_fast
field.documentation: Kinetic toroidal angular momentum of the fast ions [Nms]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: current_dr
field.documentation: Toroidal non-inductive current drive [A]; Time-dependent.

field.name: torque_jrxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque due to radial currents [N.m]; Time-dependent.

field.name: collisions_e
field.documentation: Collisional exchange with the electrons. Time-dependent

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Collisional power to the thermal particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Collisional power to the fast particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the thermal particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the fast particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: collisions_i
field.documentation: Collisional exchange with each ion species. The ion indexing should match the one in /distribution/compositions/ions.Time-dependent; Vector(nion)

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Collisional power to the thermal particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Collisional power to the fast particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the thermal particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the fast particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: collisions_z
field.documentation: Collisional exchange with each impurity species. The ion indexing should match the one in /distribution/compositions/impurities. Time-dependent; Vector(nimpur)

field.name: charge_state
field.documentation: Collisional exchange with the impurities. The ion indexing should match the one in distribution/compositions/impurities/zmin. Time-dependent; Vector(nzimp)

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Collisional power to the thermal particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Collisional power to the fast particle population [W]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the thermal particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to the fast particle population [N.m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: sources
field.documentation: Vector of volume integrated sources and sinks of particles, momentum and power included in the Fokker-Planck modelling. The physical meaning of each source term is specified through the identifier ./sources/type. Note that it is possible to store multiple source terms with the same value for ./source/type. Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: source_ref
field.documentation: Reference identifying the origin and type of source; Time-dependedent

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identifier for sources and sinks in Fokker-Planck solver; type.flag=1 for wave source, type.flag=2 for particle source, etc (see fokker_planck_source_identifier_definition in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes); Time-dependedent

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: index_waveid
field.documentation: Index pointing to /distribution/distri_vec/wave_id[index_waveid] from which the source is taken. Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: index_srcid
field.documentation: Index pointing to /distribution/distri_vec/source_id[index_waveid] from which the source is taken. Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: particle
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Scalar

field.name: momentum
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of toroidal angular momentum [Nm/s]; Time-dependedent; Scalar

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of energy [J/s]; Time-dependedent; Scalar

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged profiles.

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: Grids and metric information; including rho_tor, psi, area and volume. Time-dependent

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m]. Defined as sqrt((phi-phi_axis)/pi/B0), where B0=../global_param/toroid_field/b0, phi is the toroidal flux and phi_axis is the toroidal flux at the magnetic axis. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: The toroidal flux coordinate normalised to be zero at the axis and unity at the last closed flux surface, or last available fluxsurface if the last closed flux surface is not defined. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed by the flux surface [m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface [m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: state
field.documentation: Fluid moments describing the state of the distribution; calculated from the distribution. Time-dependent

field.name: dens
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged particle density (including both thermal and fast particles) [1/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dens_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged fast particle density [1/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres
field.documentation: Scalar pressure (including both thermal and fast particles) [J/m^3]. Related to the energy content, W, according to: pres=2*W/3. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres_fast
field.documentation: Scalar pressure of the fast particles [J/m^3]. Related to the fast particle energy content, Wf, according to: pres_fast=2*Wf/3. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres_fast_pa
field.documentation: Parallel pressure of the fast particles [J/m^3]. Related to the fast particle parallel energy content, Wfpar, according to: pres_fast_pa=2*Wfpar. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: momentm_fast
field.documentation: Kinetic toroidal angular momentum density of the fast ions [Ns/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: current
field.documentation: Total toroidal driven current density (including electron and thermal ion back-current, or drag-current) [A/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: current_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged toroidal current density of fast (non-thermal) particles (excluding electron and thermal ion back-current, or drag-current) [A.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: torque_jrxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque density due to radial currents, excluding radial current due to neoclassical effect [N/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: collisions_e
field.documentation: Collisional exchange from the background electrons to the distribution function. Time-dependent

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the thermal particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the fast particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the thermal particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the fast particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: collisions_i
field.documentation: Collisional exchange from each background ion speices to the distribution function. Time-dependent; Vector (nions)

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the thermal particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the fast particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the thermal particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the fast particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: collisions_z
field.documentation: Collisional exchange from each background impurities species to the distribution function. Time-dependent; Vector (nimpur)

field.name: charge_state
field.documentation: Collisional exchange from each charge state (or bundled charge state) to the distribution function. Time-dependent; Vector (nzimp)

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the thermal particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the fast particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the thermal particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to the fast particle population [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: thermalised
field.documentation: Representation of the flux surface averaged source of thermal particles, momentum and energy due to thermalisation. Here thermalisation refers to non-thermal particles, sufficiently assimilated to the thermal background to be re-categorised as thermal particles. Note that this source may also be negative if thermal particles are being accelerated such that they form a distinct non-thermal contribution, e.g. due run-away of RF interactions.

field.name: particle
field.documentation: Source rate for the thermal particle density due to the thermalisation of fast (non-thermal) particles [1/s/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: momentum
field.documentation: Source rate for the toroidal angular momentum density within the thermal particle population due to the thermalisation of fast (non-thermal) particles [N/m**2]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Source rate for the energy density within the thermal particle population due to the thermalisation of fast (non-thermal) particles [W/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: sources
field.documentation: Vector of flux surface averaged sources and sinks of particles, momentum and power included in the Fokker-Planck modelling. The physical meaning of each source term is specified through the identifier ./sources/type. Note that it is possible to store multiple source terms with the same value for source/type. Time-dependent; Vector(n_source_terms)

field.name: source_ref
field.documentation: Reference identifying the origin and type of source; Time-dependedent

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identifier for sources and sinks in Fokker-Planck solver; type.flag=1 for wave source, type.flag=2 for particle source, etc (see fokker_planck_source_identifier_definition in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes); Time-dependedent

field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of energy density [J/s/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: cntr_passing
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged profile evaluated using the counter-current passing particle part of the distribution.

field.name: state
field.documentation: Fluid moments describing the state of the distribution; calculated from the distribution. Time-dependent

field.name: dens
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged particle density (including both thermal and fast particles) [1/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dens_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged fast particle density [1/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres
field.documentation: Scalar pressure (including both thermal and fast particles) [J/m^3]. Related to the energy content, W, according to: pres=2*W/3. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres_fast
field.documentation: Scalar pressure of the fast particles [J/m^3]. Related to the fast particle energy content, Wf, according to: pres_fast=2*Wf/3. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pres_fast_pa
field.documentation: Parallel pressure of the fast particles [J/m^3]. Related to the fast particle parallel energy content, Wfpar, according to: pres_fast_pa=2*Wfpar. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: momentm_fast
field.documentation: Kinetic toroidal angular momentum density of the fast ions [Ns/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: current
field.documentation: Total toroidal driven current density (including electron and thermal ion back-current, or drag-current) [A/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: current_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged toroidal current density of fast (non-thermal) particles (excluding electron and thermal ion back-current, or drag-current) [A.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: torque_jrxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque density due to radial currents, excluding radial current due to neoclassical effect [N/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: collisions_e
field.documentation: Collisional exchange from the background electrons to the distribution function. Time-dependent

field.name: power_th
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the thermal particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: power_fast
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power density to the fast particle population [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: torque_th

field.documentation: Collisional exchange from each background ion speices to the distribution function. Time-dependent; Vector (nions)

field.name: torque_fast

field.name: sources
field.documentation: Vector of flux surface averaged sources and sinks of particles, momentum and power included in the Fokker-Planck modelling. The physical meaning of each source term is specified through the identifier ./sources/type. Note that it is possible to store multiple source terms with the same value for source/type. Time-dependent; Vector(n_source_terms)

field.name: source_ref
field.documentation: Reference identifying the origin and type of source; Time-dependedent

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identifier for sources and sinks in Fokker-Planck solver; type.flag=1 for wave source, type.flag=2 for particle source, etc (see fokker_planck_source_identifier_definition in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes); Time-dependedent

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: index_waveid
field.documentation: Index pointing to /distribution/distri_vec/wave_id[index_waveid] from which the source is taken. Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: index_srcid
field.documentation: Index pointing to /distribution/distri_vec/source_id[index_waveid] from which the source is taken. Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: particle
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of particles density [1/s/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: momentum
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of toroidal angular momentum density [Nm/s/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Source (or sink) rate of energy density [J/s/m**3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: profiles_2d
field.documentation: 2D profiles in the poloidal plane

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: Grids and metric information; including R, Z, rho_tor, psi, theta_geom and theta_strt. The grid has to be rectangular in a pair of these coordinates; this is specified in coord_type. Time-dependent

field.name: coord_type
field.documentation: 0: Rectangular grid in the (R,Z) coordinates; 1: Rectangular grid in the (rho_tor,theta_geom) coordinates; 2: Rectangular grid in the (rho_tor,theta_straight) coordinates.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius coordinate [m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: z
field.documentation: Vertical coordinate [m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m]. Defined as sqrt((phi-phi_axis)/pi/B0), where B0=../global_param/toroid_field/b0, phi is the toroidal flux and phi_axis is the toroidal flux at the magnetic axis. Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: theta_geom
field.documentation: Geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: theta_strt
field.documentation: Straight field line poloidal angle [rad]; Time-dependent; Matrix (n_coord1,n_coord2)

field.name: dist_func
field.documentation: Distribution functions. The total distribution total distribution can either be given by the a set of markers/test particles (in markers), or by a gridded function (dist_expand). Note that the gridded distribution can be written as sum of successive approximations, where each term is given by an element in the vector dist_expand. Finally, the distribution can be written as a sum of a marker distribution and a gridded distribution, e.g. for delta-f Monte Carlo solution. Time-dependent

field.name: is_delta_f
field.documentation: If is_delta_f=1, then the distribution represents the deviation from a Maxwellian; is_delta_f=0, then the distribution represents all particles, i.e. the full-f solution. Time-dependent

field.name: markers
field.documentation: Distribution represented by a set of markers (test particles). Time-dependent

field.name: variable_ids
field.documentation: Identifier for the variable_ids stored in the coord matrix (see coordinate_identifier_definitions in the Documentation website under Conventions/Enumerated_datatypes). Vector(NDIM)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: coord
field.documentation: Coordinates of the markers. The coordinates used is specified in variable_ids. Time-dependent; Float(NMARK,NDIM)

field.name: weight
field.documentation: Weight of the marker; number of real particles represented by the marker. Time-dependent; Float(NMARK)

field.name: f_expan_topo
field.documentation: TO BE REMOVED. KEPT TEMPORARILY AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO f_expansion. [Distribution function, f, expanded into a vector of successive approximations (topology-based formulation, without the grid-cpo). The first element in the vector (f_expansion(1)) is the zeroth order distribution function, while the K:th elemnet in the vector (f_expansion(K)) is the K:th correction, such that the total distribution function is a sum over all elements in the f_expansion vector. Time-dependent. Structure array(Nf_expansion)]. Time-dependent

field.name: grid_info
field.documentation: Specification of grids used in topo_regions. Grid coordinates could either be invariants of motion, or information at single point along orbit, e.g. xi and s for grid_coord=3. This point should always be on a so-called omnigenous surface (a generalised equitorial plane); grad(psi) x grad(B) = 0. All closed orbits cross omnigenous surfaces at least two times. The omnigenous surfaces are described in omnigen_surf.

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of grid: 1=unstructured grid; 2=structured non-rectangular grid, here ndim11=ndim12=ndim13, ndim21=ndim22=ndim23, ndim31=ndim32=ndim33; 3=rectangular grid, where grid coordinates are stored in the vectors dim1(1:ndim1,1,1), dim2(1,1:ndim2,1), dim3(1,1,1:ndim3)

field.name: ngriddim
field.documentation: Number of grid dimension. For ngriddim=2 the grid is specified by dim1 and dim2 only, while dim3, dim4, dim5, dim6 can be ignored (should not be allocated). For ngriddim=3 also dim3 is used to describe the grid etc. E.g. if your distribution is given by the three variables the poloidal flux, perpendicular and parallel velocities, then ngriddim=3 and grid_coord(1)=15, grid_coord(1)=16, grid_coord(3)=6.

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1, dim2, dim3, dim4, dim5, and dim6. grid_coord(K) describes the coordinate representaed in dimK, for K=1,2...6. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T*m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin; 24=n_Legendre, the index of the Legendre polynomial of the pitch, e.g. if the k:th component of dim3(1,1,k,1,1,1)=5 then this refer to the 5:th Legendre polynomial P_5(xi). Vector (6)

field.name: thin_orbits
field.documentation: Specifies if guiding centre orbits are thin. Note: only used for orbit averaged distribution functions. For thin_orbits=1 the orbit are considered thin, i.e. each orbit is bound to follow a single flux surface; for thin_orbits=0 the orbits are asumed to follow guiding centre trajectories. E.g. thin_orbits=0 using constants of motion as given in a generalised equitorial plane, then the orbit outside the equitorial plane are described by the guiding centre equations of motion.

field.name: topology
field.documentation: Description of the topology of the grid. NOTE: only used for nregion_topo>2.

field.name: omnigen_surf
field.documentation: List of omnigeuous magnetic surfaces to which the s-coordinates in grid_coord refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. NOTE: all guiding centre orbits intersect at least one omnigeuous (or stagnation) surfaces, i.e. the omnigeuous generalised the equitorial plane (the midplane). nsurfs=Number of omnigenous surfaces. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: rz
field.documentation: (R,z) coordinates of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector rz1d (nsurfs)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: s
field.documentation: Coordinates which uniquely maps the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector (nsurfs)

field.name: topo_regions
field.documentation: List with distribution function in each topological region; Time-dependent. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: ind_omnigen
field.documentation: Index of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane) to which the s-coordinates refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3.

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim21, ndim31, ndim41, ndim51, ndim61).

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim12, ndim22, ndim32, ndim42, ndim52, ndim62).

field.name: dim3
field.documentation: Third dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim13, ndim23, ndim33, ndim43, ndim53, ndim63).

field.name: dim4
field.documentation: Fourth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim14, ndim24, ndim34, ndim44, ndim54, ndim64).

field.name: dim5
field.documentation: Fifth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim15, ndim25, ndim35, ndim45, ndim55, ndim65).

field.name: dim6
field.documentation: Sixth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim16, ndim26, ndim36, ndim46, ndim56, ndim66).

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the transformation of the phase space grid variables; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: distfunc
field.documentation: Orbit (or bounce) averaged distribution function given on a grid [1/m^3 (m/s)^-3]; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: f_expansion
field.documentation: Distribution function, f, expanded into a vector of successive approximations. The first element in the vector (f_expansion(1)) is the zeroth order distribution function, while the K:th element in the vector (f_expansion(K)) is the K:th correction, such that the total distribution function is a sum over all elements in the f_expansion vector. Time-dependent. Structure array(Nf_expansion)

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Grid for storing the distribution function. Time-dependent; Complexgrid

field.name: uid
field.documentation: Unique index of this grid. Used for handling multiple grids

field.name: id
field.documentation: Name / identifier string for this grid

field.name: spaces
field.documentation: Definitions of grid spaces. Array of structures (number of spaces)

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id flags). Flags defining how the geometry (objects.geo) fields associated with; space objects are to be interpreted. Array (number of geometries defined for this space),; first dimension: geometry index. A flag value of GRID_UNDEFINED=0 indicates the standard interpretation for; the given coordinates.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of space geometries (id string). See geotype.

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: objects
field.documentation: Definition of the space objects.; Array of structures (dimension of highest-dimensional objects).; First dimension: dimension of the objects (1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, ...)

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Lists of (n-1)-dimensional space objects defining the boundary of an n-dimensional space object.; Matrix(number of objects of dimension n, maximum number of boundary objects).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary object index

field.name: neighbour
field.documentation: Connectivity information. Array (number of objects, maximum number of boundaries per object, maximum number of neighbours per boundary).; Stores the indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object.;An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on every boundary.; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary index, third dimension: neighbour index on the boundary.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with every object. Float array (number of objects, number of geometry coeff. 1, number of geometry coeff. 2, number of geometries).; The exact definition depends on the geometry type of the space (complexgrid_space.geotype).; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: geometry coefficient matrix row+column, third dimension: geometry index (for definition of multiple geometries).

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of space objects, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...). [m^dim].; First dimension: object index, second dimension: geometry index

field.name: xpoints
field.documentation: List of indices of all nodes which are x-points. Vector (number of x-points)

field.name: subgrids
field.documentation: Definitions of subgrids. Array of structures (number of subgrids)

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID string (name) of the subgrid.

field.name: list
field.documentation: List of object lists. Array of structures (number of object lists).

field.name: cls
field.documentation: Class tuple of the grid objects in this object list. Vector (number of grid spaces)

field.name: indset
field.documentation: Implicit list of the object indices.; Array of structures (number of grid spaces = length of index tuple). Every index of the index tuple is described by an index set, which defines either a list of index values or a range of index values.

field.name: range
field.documentation: Defines an index range enumerating from range[1] to range[2] (with both range[1] and range[2] included). If additionally a third value range(3) is given, it is used as a stride. If it is omitted, a stride of 1 is assumed. Vector(3)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: An explicit list of indices. If this member is defined and has nonzero size, the list is assumed to be explicit. Vector(length of explicit index list)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: Explicit list of index tuples. Matrix (number of objects, number of spaces in grid).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: index tuple/space index.; If this field is defined and has nonzero size, the object list is understood to be explicit.

field.name: metric
field.documentation: Metric coefficients

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim].; Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.; Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: g11
field.documentation: Metric coefficients g11. Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.documentation: Jacobian. Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data for implicit objects

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of geometry (id flag). A flag defining how the geometry data associated with grid objects is to be interpreted. If the field is undefined (0=GRID_UNDEFINED), the standard interpretation for; the given coordinate types is assumed.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of geometry (id string).

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: geo_matrix
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with implicit objects. Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on); The exact definition of the stored values depends on the geometry type of the geometry complexgrid_geo_global.geotype;

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects) in this geometry. [m^dim].; Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.; Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: bases
field.documentation: Vector bases. Used for aligned vector representation. Time-dependent (added systematically for the COMP child inheritance of that property). Array of structures (number of bases)

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this vector quantity is associated with.

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label describing the data

field.name: comp
field.documentation: Components of the vector. Array of structures (number of vector components). Time-dependent; FIXME: inherit time-dependence for this element

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: align
field.documentation: Alignment flag for vector components. Integer vector (number of vector components).

field.name: alignid
field.documentation: Alignment id for vector components. String vector (number of vector components).

field.name: basis
field.documentation: Index of basis (defined in associated grid) this vector is aligned to; If set to GRID_UNDEFINED=0, the canonical basis of the default coordinates of the grid assumed.

field.name: values
field.documentation: Values of the distribution function [m^-3 (m/s)^-3]. Time-dependent; Complexgrid_scalar.

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: Parameters used to defined the grid coordinates. Time-dependent

field.name: equatorial
field.documentation: Description of the equatorial plane or any other omnigeuous surfaces. Time-dependent

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius coordinate of the equitorial plane (m). Time-dependent; Vector(n_equitorial_grid)

field.name: z
field.documentation: Major radius coordinate of the equitorial plane (m). Time-dependent; Vector(n_equitorial_grid)

field.name: s
field.documentation: Distance along the poloidal projection of the equitorial plane (m). Here s=0 should be at the magnetic axis, s>0 on the low field side and s<0 on the high field side. For example, in up-down symmetric fields s=R-R0, where R is the major radius and R0 the major radius at the magnetic axis. Time-dependent; Vector(n_equatorial_grid)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m]. Defined as sqrt((phi-phi_axis)/pi/B0), where B0 is the reference magnetic field, phi is the toroidal flux and phi_axis is the toroidal flux at the magnetic axis. Time-dependent; Vector (n_equitorial_grid)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux [Wb], evaluated without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (n_equitorial_grid)

field.name: b_mod
field.documentation: The modulous of the magnetic field along the equitorial plane, or more generally of the omnigeuous surfaces [T]. Time-dependent; Vector (n_equatorial_grid)

field.name: temperature
field.documentation: Reference temperature profile (eV); on the grid in /distsource/source/profiles_1d/rho_tor. Used to define the local thermal energy and the thermal velocity. Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
