field.name: compositions
field.documentation: Pellet composition

field.name: nuclei
field.documentation: Array of nuclei considered.

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge [units of elementary charge];

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Mass of atom [amu]

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying element (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Array of main plasma ions.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: impurities
field.documentation: Array of impurities.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the ions array of structures. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: pellet
field.documentation: Description of the pellets entering the plasma at given time. Array of structures (NPEL). Time-dependent.

field.name: shape
field.documentation: Structure defining the shape of the pellet. Time-dependent.

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identifier for the shape of the pellet: 1-spherical; 2-cylindrical; 3-rectangular; 4-generic. Time-dependent.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: dimensions
field.documentation: Vector specifying the dimensions of the pellet following the order for predefined shapes. Spherical pellets: dimensions(1) is the radius [m] of the pellet; Cylindrical pellets: dimensions(1) is the radius [m] and dimensions(2) is the height [m] of the cylinder; Rectangular pellets: dimensions(1) is the height [m], dimensions(2) is the width [m] and dimensions(3) is the length [m]; Time-dependent.

field.name: elements
field.documentation: Structure defining the composition of the pellet. Time-dependent.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei, array over elements in pellet (NATM). Time-dependent.

field.name: density
field.documentation: Material density of each element of the pellet, array over elements (NATM). Time-dependent.

field.name: fraction
field.documentation: Fraction of each element in the pellet, array over elements in pellet (NATM). Time-dependent.

field.name: subl_energy
field.documentation: Sublimation energy per atom, array over elements in pellet (NATM). Time-dependent.

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: Structure describing the geometry of the pellet path. Time-dependent.

field.name: pivot_point
field.documentation: Coordinates of the pivot point for pellet trajectory. Time-dependent.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: second_point
field.documentation: Coordinates of the second point for pellet trajectory. Time-dependent.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: velocity
field.documentation: Starting velocity of the pellet [m/s]. Scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: angles
field.documentation: Angles of the pellet trajectory. Time-dependent.

field.name: horizontal
field.documentation: Angle [rad] of the horizontal projection of the path with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS , then counter clockwise looking from above), scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: vertical
field.documentation: Angle [rad] of the path with vertical axis section (0 for bottom-top trajectory, then counter clockwise), scalar. Time-dependent.

field.name: pathprofiles
field.documentation: Structure describing 1-D profiles of plasma and pellet along the pellet path. Time-dependent.

field.name: distance
field.documentation: Coordinate along the pellet trajectory [m], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate along the pellet trajectory [m], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_pol
field.documentation: Poloidal flux coordinate along the pellet trajectory [m], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: velocity
field.documentation: Pellet velocity along the pellet trajectory [m/s], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: ne
field.documentation: Electron density along the pellet trajectory [m^-3], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: te
field.documentation: Electron temperature along the pellet trajectory [eV], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: abl_rate
field.documentation: Ablation rate along the pellet trajectory [part/s], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: abl_particles
field.documentation: Number of ablated particles along the pellet trajectory [part], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_drift
field.documentation: Radial displacement due to ExB drifts along the pellet trajectory [m], array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: position
field.documentation: Coordinates of the pellet trajectory line, array (NPATH). Time-dependent.

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: deposition
field.documentation: Structure defining the pellet action on the plasma (along rho_tor). Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m], array (NRHO). Time-dependent.

field.name: rho_pol
field.documentation: Poloidal flux coordinate [m], array(NRHO). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_ne
field.documentation: Instant change of ne profile due to pellet ablation [m^-3], array(NRHO). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_te
field.documentation: Instant change of Te profile due to pellet ablation [eV], array(NRHO). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_ni
field.documentation: Instant change of ni profile due to pellet ablation [m^-3], array (NRHO, NION). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_ti
field.documentation: Instant change of Ti profile due to pellet ablation [eV], array (NRHO, NION). Time-dependent.

field.name: delta_vtor
field.documentation: Instant change of Vtor profile due to pellet ablation [m/s], array (NRHO, NION). Time-dependent.

field.name: impurity
field.documentation: Contributions to impurity array of structures (NIMP). Time-dependent

field.name: delta_nz
field.documentation: Instant change of Nz profile (per charge state) due to pellet ablation [m^-3], array (NRHO, NZIMP). Time-dependent.

field.name: turnsign

field.name: area

field.name: pfgeometry

field.name: npoints

field.name: rzcoordinate
field.documentation: Irregular outline [m]; 3D arrays (ncoils,max_nelements,max_npoints)

field.name: coilcurrent

field.name: pfcircuits
field.documentation: Circuits, connected to multiple coils and to multiple supplies, defining the current and voltage relationships in the system

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

field.name: nnodes
field.documentation: Number of nodes used to describe a circuit. Vector (ncircuits)

field.name: connections
field.documentation: Description of the supplies and coils connections (nodes) across each circuit. Array 3D (ncircuits,max_nnodes,2*ncomponents), describing for each node which component are connected to it (1 if connected, 0 otherwise). There are 2 sides at each component, thus 2*ncomponents as the size of the third dimension, listing first all supplies, then all coils (in the same order as listed in PFSUPPLIES and PFCOILS). An example can be found in the data structure documentation PFconnections.pdf

field.documentation: PF power supplies

field.name: delay
field.documentation: Pure delay in the supply [s]; Vector (nsupplies)

field.name: filter
field.documentation: Laplace proper filter

field.name: num
field.documentation: Coefficients of the numerator, in increasing order : a0 + a1*s + ... + an*s^n; Matrix (nsupplies,n)

field.name: den
field.documentation: Coefficients of the denominator, in increasing order : b0 + b1*s + ... + bm*s^m; Matrix (nsupplies,m)

field.name: imax
field.documentation: Maximum current [A]; Vector (nsupplies)

field.documentation: Minimum voltage [V]; Vector (nsupplies)

field.documentation: Maximum voltage [V]; Vector (nsupplies)

field.name: emax

field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: expression
field.documentation: Formal expression for the line integral to be evaluated as a function of ne, ni, Te, Ti, Zeff, Br, Bz

field.name: setup_line
field.documentation: Geometric description of the lines of sight

field.name: pivot_point
field.documentation: Pivot point of each line of sight; Vector (nchords)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: horchordang1
field.documentation: Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

field.name: verchordang1
field.documentation: Angle of chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: width
field.documentation: Width of the laser beam (1/e) [m]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: second_point
field.documentation: Second point defining the line of sight together with the pivot_point. In case the probing wave is reflected, this should be the position of the mirror. This data is redundant with horchordang1 and verchordang1. Vector (nchords).

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: horchordang2
field.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of reflected l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

field.name: verchordang2
field.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle of reflected chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

field.name: third_point
field.documentation: Third point defining the reflected line of sight together with the second_point (undefined if the probing wave is not reflected). This data is redundant with horchordang2 and verchordang2. Vector (nchords).

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: nchordpoints
field.documentation: Number of points along the viewing chords (used for synthetic diagnostic signal reconstruction)

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measured value. Time-dependent; Vector (nchords)

field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector

field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: refl_receive
field.documentation: Reflectometry signal; experimental or code output. Time-dependent. Vector(nreceivers); If output from ERC3D, contains short, high-resolution (ps) time series anchored to the time of the CPO or, for a combination of runs, longer, coarse time signals. For experimental signals, time series may span much longer durations. For slowly varying signals, may contain only one point and have a seperate CPO instance with different time field for every point. For code output, the signals are usually normalised to unity power.

field.name: name
field.documentation: Signal name

field.name: raw_signal
field.documentation: Raw antenna signal, possibly code dependent, may not always be available; usually without mixing of local oscillator; Time series; Vector (ntime_raw); Time-dependent

field.name: time_wind
field.documentation: Time trace [s]; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: values
field.documentation: Values of the sigal; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: io_signal
field.documentation: Local oscillator signal, for mixing with raw signal; Time series; Vector (ntime_raw); Time-dependent

field.name: time_wind
field.documentation: Time trace [s]; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: values
field.documentation: Values of the sigal; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: iq_receiver
field.documentation: I and Q signals from the receiver; already processed by code (or hardware); Time series; Vector (ntime_receiver); Time-dependent

field.name: time_wind
field.documentation: Time trace [s]; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: values_re
field.documentation: Real part of data; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: values_im
field.documentation: Imaginary part of data; Time-dependent; Vector (n)

field.name: antenna_ind
field.documentation: Index of the receiving antenna in the antennas vector, starting at 0

field.name: antennas
field.documentation: Vector of reflectometry antenna descriptions. These include radiation fields as well as material antenna structures (feeds, horns, later mirrors); Vector(nantennas); refl_received entries refer to their antenna by index in this array. Time-dependent.

field.name: name
field.documentation: Antenna name

field.name: type
field.documentation: Antenna type: 1: sending, 2: receiving, 3: both

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: refpos
field.documentation: Reference point of the local coordinate system; the position of either the last quasi-optical element, or the horn antenna. Default is facing horizontally away from the central axis. The local coordinate system is cartesian, with the local z axis defining the nominal beam direction, x parallel to the global z, and y completing the right-handed local coordinate system

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle [rad]

field.name: alpha
field.documentation: Poloidal tilt angle [rad]; angle between local z axis and horizontal plane, 0 is facing outward, pi/2 is downwards, pi inwards

field.name: beta
field.documentation: Toroidal tilt angle [rad]; angle between local z axis and r-z plane

field.name: gamma
field.documentation: Rotation angle about local z axis [rad]

field.name: radfield
field.documentation: Complex valued radiation field for injection into grid; Can be a Gaussian, or a waveguide mode, or an arbitrary E field. The latter method can be used with measured radiation patterns of actual antennas. Needs to be matched with any material structures in the geometry section of this CPO. Frequency dependence: in the launchsignal part, the lauch frequency can be varied arbitrarily, which changes the radiation field (or Gaussian waist sizes) when radiated from a fixed size antenna; therefor, all entries here can be specified frequency-dependent; Time-dependent

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify type of source: 0: Gaussian, 1: waveguide mode, 2: arbitrary E field; corresponding substructure must be filled to provide the information.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: position
field.documentation: Center position in local x-y-z coordinate system [m]; Vector(3)

field.name: gaussian
field.documentation: Parameters if radiation field is a pure Gaussian; major axes of the Gaussian are aligned with the x and y axis of the local coordinate system given in origin; linear polarisation only. Time-dependent

field.name: aperture
field.documentation: Physical limits of the Gaussian wave field; any rotation here is at odds with the Gaussian geometry

field.name: type
field.documentation: Shape identifier; 0: rectangular, 1: elliptical

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: sizes
field.documentation: Rectangular size a, b or diameters for elliptical shapes [m]; Time-dependent; Vector (2)

field.name: angle
field.documentation: Rotation of aperture around its center [rad]

field.name: waistsize
field.documentation: Beam waist size [m]; Vector(2)

field.name: waistzpos
field.documentation: Beam waist position along local z axis [m]; Vector(2)

field.name: tiltangle
field.documentation: tilt angle relative to local z axis [rad]; Vector(2)

field.name: polar_angle
field.documentation: Polarisation angle around local z [rad]; 0 means along the local x axis, i.e. vertical if all angles in the origin field are 0; Scalar

field.name: frequency
field.documentation: Frequency for this occurrence of the gaussian/efield/wgmode CPO [Hz]; Scalar; can be zero of no frequency dependence is desired and only one CPO is given; Time-dependent

field.name: efield
field.documentation: complex electric field at the aperture, given as a 2d grid in the local x and y directions (corresponding to dim1 and dim2); Time-dependent

field.name: grid2d
field.documentation: Coordinate values for the grid for the electric field arrays. Vector(ndim1) and Vector(ndim2); Time-dependent

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension values; Vector (ndim1)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension values; Vector (ndim2)

field.name: e1
field.documentation: Electric field component along local x direction [V/m]. Matrix(ndim1,ndim2); Time-dependent

field.name: e2
field.documentation: Electric field component along local y direction [V/m]. Matrix(ndim1,ndim2); Time-dependent

field.name: frequency
field.documentation: Frequency for this occurrence of the gaussian/efield/wgmode CPO [Hz]; Scalar; can be zero of no frequency dependence is desired and only one CPO is given; Time-dependent

field.name: geometry
field.documentation: To be defined: annotation and type

field.name: time_launch
field.documentation: Time stamp for particular event e.g. ramp of frequency sweep (but it should not be needed since it should be tied to the cpo time ! ); Time-dependent

field.name: freq
field.documentation: Frequency of the injected waves (should not be needed since it is already used in the injected signal !), typical data stored experimentally; Time-dependent

field.name: amplitude
field.documentation: Amplitude of the injected waves (essential if using gaussian, already encoded in the Electric field pattern), typical data stored experimentally; Time-dependent

field.name: phase
field.documentation: Phase of the sinusoidal (e.g. voltage) signal injected in the antenna, typical data stored experimentally; Time-dependent

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: crash_trig
field.documentation: Flag indicating whether a crash condition has been satisfied : 0 = no crash. N(>0) = crash triggered due to condition ii=N. Integer. Time-dependent.

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species). OBSOLESCENT.

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the ions - note the charge state is not included; String Vector (nion)

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate values (= rho_tor normalised to the value at the last grid point); Vector (nrho)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m] given by sqrt(phi/B0/pi), where B0 = toroidfield%bvac_r%value / toroidfield%r0. Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: profiles1d
field.documentation: Core profiles after sawtooth crash

field.name: ne
field.documentation: Electron density [m^-3]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: ni
field.documentation: Ion density [m^-3]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion).

field.name: te
field.documentation: Electron temperature [eV]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: ti
field.documentation: Ion temperature [eV]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion).

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal flux [Wb]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: psistar
field.documentation: Psi* = psi - phi [Wb]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed in the flux surface [m^3]. Required to ensure particle and energy conservation during reconnection process (ndV and (nT)dV are conserved). Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor = dphi/dpsi [-]. Time-dependent. Vector (nrho).

field.name: shear1
field.documentation: Magnetic shear at q = 1 [-]. Time-dependent. Real scalar.

field.name: rhotorn_q1
field.documentation: Rho_tor_norm at q=1 radius [-]. Time-dependent. Real scalar.

field.name: rhotorn_inv
field.documentation: Rho_tor_norm at inversion radius [-]. Time-dependent. Real scalar.

field.name: rhotorn_mix
field.documentation: Rho_tor_norm at mixing radius [-]. Time-dependent. Real scalar.

field.name: config
field.documentation: plasma configuration (limiter/divertor ...) []. Time-dependent. Possible values : 0 = undetermined; 1 = poloidal limiter (ring); 2 = poloidal limiter (LFS); 3 = poloidal limiter (HFS); 4 = toroidal limiter (ring); 5 = toroidal limiter (segment); 6 = poloidal divertor; 7 = toroidal divertor (single null, ion drift in direction of divertor); 8 = toroidal divertor (single null, ion drift in oposite direction of divertor); 9 = toroidal divertor (double null).

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

CPO.documentation: SOL current diagnostic. Time-dependent CPO

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

field.name: id
field.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: sol_current
field.documentation: Vector of toroidal rings of divertor tiles. Structure array(nrings). Time-dependent

field.name: setup
field.documentation: diagnostic setup information

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the toroidally distributed tile set. String.

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID of the tile set as a scalar, to be used in connectivity. Integer.

field.name: position
field.documentation: RZ points defining the shape of the toroidal tile set [m]; Vector (npoints)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: tiles_turn
field.documentation: Number of tiles used to get the full toroidal coverage; Scalar

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measured value for the current through the toroidal ring of tiles [A]; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: clusters
field.documentation: Cluster of tile rings to define and reference superset structures using the individual tile rings. A coil ring can coexist on two top level structures. Structure array (ncluster).

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the toroidally distributed tile set. String.

field.name: start
field.documentation: ID of the tile set as a scalar where this superset starts. Integer.

field.name: finish
field.documentation: ID of the tile set as a scalar where this superset finishes. Integer.

field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar.

CPO.documentation: General Wall representation. Time-dependent CPO.

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

field.name: id
field.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: wall0d
field.documentation: Simple 0D description of plasma-wall interaction

field.name: pumping_speed
field.documentation: pumping speed; Time-dependent. vector(nneut); [particles/s]

field.name: gas_puff
field.documentation: gas puff; vector(nneut); Time-dependent. [particles/s]

field.name: wall_inventory
field.documentation: wall inventory; vector(nneut); Time-dependent. [particles]

field.name: recycling_coefficient
field.documentation: Recycling coefficient. Vector(nneut) Time-dependent.

field.name: wall_temperature
field.documentation: Wall temperature [K]. Time-dependent. Scalar

field.name: power_from_plasma
field.documentation: Power flowing from the plasma to the wall [W]. Time-dependent. Scalar

field.name: power_to_cooling
field.documentation: Power to cooling systems [W]. Time-dependent. Scalar

field.name: species_index
field.documentation: Index of species into wall/compositions; matrix(nspecies,3); 1st element indicates {1: main ions; 2:impurities; 3:neutrals; 4:edge species); 2nd element indicates index into that array; 3rd index indicates charge state if 1st element points to inpurities or neutral type if 1st element points to neutrals;

field.name: flux
field.documentation: flux of species indicated by species_index; array of nspecies; positive implies incoming onto wall; negative implies sent back into plasma; time-dependent; [particles/s]

field.name: energy
field.documentation: energy flux of species indicated by species_index; array of nspecies; positive implies incoming onto wall; negative implies sent back into plasma; time-dependent; [W]

field.name: wall2d_mhd
field.documentation: Simplified wall that encloses necessary information for RWM codes.

field.name: res_wall
field.documentation: Resistive Wall(s).

field.name: walltype
field.documentation: Tag the type of wall to be used, 0 (conformal) or 1 (free)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: delta
field.documentation: Wall thickness [m]; Scalar

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Wall resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

field.name: npoloidal
field.documentation: Number of poloidal coordinates for each wall (dimension of R and Z);

field.name: position
field.documentation: RZ description of the wall; wall coordinates are defined at a middle line (line passing through the middle of the real wall as defined by thickness parameter delta)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: holes
field.documentation: Structure to describe the placing and properties of the holes

field.name: n_holes
field.documentation: Number of holes on each wall;

field.name: coordinates
field.documentation: Poloidal and Toroidal coordinates of the center of each hole;

field.name: theta
field.documentation: Theta coordinate of holes center; Vector (n_holes)

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal coordinate of holes center; Vector (n_holes)

field.name: width
field.documentation: Angular width of each in the poloidal and toroidal direction;

field.name: dtheta
field.documentation: Angular poloidal width of holes; Vector (n_holes)

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Angular toroidal width of holes; Vector (n_holes)

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Resistivity of each hole [ohm.m]; Vector (n_holes)

field.name: ideal_wall
field.documentation: Ideal wall

field.name: walltype
field.documentation: Tag the type of wall to be used, 0 (conformal) or 1 (free)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: position
field.documentation: RZ description of the wall;

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: wall2d
field.documentation: 2D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, single contour limiter, disjoint gapped plasma facing components, ...). Time-dependent

field.name: wall_id
field.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of 2d wall you are using. Use 0 for equilibrium codes (single closed limiter and vessel); 1 for gas-tight walls (disjoint PFCs with inner vessel as last limiter_unit; no vessel structure); 2 for free boundary codes (disjoint PFCs and vessel)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: limiter
field.documentation: Description of the immobile limiting surface(s) or plasma facing components for defining the Last Closed Flux Surface. Two representations are admitted : single contour or disjoint PFC. The limiter_id identifies the type of limiter set and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nlimiter_type). Time-dependent

field.name: limiter_id
field.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of limiter you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single contour limiter and 1 for the official disjoint PFC structure like first wall. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: limiter_unit
field.documentation: Array of ncomponents limiting surfaces making up the limiter type (single contour or disjoint PFC). Replicate this limiter_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a plasma facing component that can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (ncomponents). Time-dependent

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name or description of the limiter_unit

field.name: closed
field.documentation: Identify whether the contour is closed (y) or open (n)

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a limiting surface. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Wall resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

field.name: delta
field.documentation: Wall thickness [m] (Optional if a closed facing component is given but useful for simpler closed contour limiter); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: permeability
field.documentation: Vessel relative permeability; Scalar

field.name: vessel
field.documentation: Mechanical structure of the vacuum vessel. Vessel assumed as set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or blocks. The vessel_id identifies the type of vessel_unit set one is using and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nvessel_type)

field.name: vessel_id
field.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of vessel you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single/multiple annular vessel and 1 for the official block element representation for each vessel unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: vessel_unit
field.documentation: Array of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

field.name: annular
field.documentation: Annular representation of a vessel layer by two free-hand contours.

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name or description of the vessel_unit

field.name: inside
field.documentation: Inner Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: outside
field.documentation: Outer Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_outer)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Vessel resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

field.name: permeability
field.documentation: Vessel relative permeability; Scalar

field.name: blocks
field.documentation: Block element representation of vessel units. Each vessel unit is decomposed in elementary small units (blocks) caracyerized by a position, resistivity and relative permeability.

field.name: blocks_unit
field.documentation: Vector of blocks that build of the vessel layer. Replicate this element nblocks times. Each unit contains a building block of the vessel and can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (nblocks)

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name or description of the blocks_unit

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a vessel segment. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Resistivity of the vessel segment [ohm.m]; Scalar

field.name: permeability
field.documentation: Vessel relative permeability; Scalar

field.name: j_phi
field.documentation: induced currents inside the vessel; time dependent; [A]

field.name: resistance
field.documentation: resistance of block; [Ohm]

field.name: radial_build
field.documentation: Simple description of this vessel unit for the radial_build in system codes

field.name: r1_inb
field.documentation: Inner radius (nearest to the plasma), in the global tokamak coordinate system of the vv measured at the equatorial plane (inboard side) [m]; Scalar

field.name: r2_inb
field.documentation: Outer radius (farest from the plasma), in the global tokamak coordinate system of the vv measured at the equatorial plane (inboard side) [m]; Scalar

field.name: r1_outb
field.documentation: Inner radius (nearest to the plasma), in the global tokamak coordinate system of the vv measured at the equatorial plane (outboard side) [m]; Scalar

field.name: r2_outb
field.documentation: Outer radius (farest from the plasma), in the global tokamak coordinate system of the vv measured at the equatorial plane (outboard side) [m]; Scalar

field.name: raddim
field.documentation: Radial thickness of the vacuum vessel; Scalar

field.name: nmat
field.documentation: Number of materials; Scalar

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Inboard shield radial build giving the percentage of each material respectively (Meaning of the material index 1: Eurofer, 2: Pb-15.7Li, 3: He, 4: Water, 5: Tungsten Carbide, 6: Boron, 7: Tungsten, 8: Stainless Steel 316) in %vol; Vector

field.name: pow_dens_inb
field.documentation: Peak energy depostion in vaccum vessel inboard [W.m^-3]; Scalar

field.name: pow_dens_outb
field.documentation: Peak energy depostion in vaccum vessel outboard [W.m^-3]; Scalar

field.name: fn_flux_inb
field.documentation: Fast neutron flux in vaccum vessel inboard [m^2.s^-1]; Scalar

field.name: fn_flux_outb
field.documentation: Fast neutron flux in vaccum vessel outboard [m^2.s^-1]; Scalar

field.name: plasma
field.documentation: Description of incoming plasma for every wall component. Array of structures (number of wall components). The geometry of the wall component with index i is given by the limiter unit with index i in wall/wall2d/limiter/limiter_unit. Time-dependent

field.name: species
field.documentation: Definition of plasma species. Index into wall/compositions/edgespecies. Integer vector (number of plasma species).

field.name: flux
field.documentation: Plasma particle flux density from/to plasma facing wall surfaces [1/(m^2 s)]. Positive means incoming onto the wall, negative means sent back into the plasma. Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of plasma species, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: b
field.documentation: Magnetic field vector at the surface [T]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of space dimensions, number of discretization elements in the subgrid). If two-dimensional: unit vectors with first coordinate perpendicular to the wall facing towards the plasma, second coordinate parallel to the surface (in the direction of the surface discretization), third dimension is zero. If three-dimensional: vector is relative to basis vectors stored in wall/wall3d/grid/basis with basis index as given in wall/wall3d/basis_index.

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Total energy flux density of incoming particles of given species [W/m^2]; Positive means incoming onto the wall, negative means sent back into the plasma. Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of plasma species, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: wall_state
field.documentation: Dynamic wall state of every wall component. Array of structures (number of wall components). The geometry of the wall component with index i is given by the limiter unit with index i in wall/wall2d/limiter/limiter_unit. Time-dependent

field.name: wall_type
field.documentation: Definition of reference wall composition for every subgrid of the wall discretization. Vector of integers (number of subgrids). The indices point to wall/wall_types.

field.name: n_depo_layer
field.documentation: Number of deposited layers (in addition to the engineering layers)

field.name: layers
field.documentation: Data on wall element layers; Array of structures (number of engineering layers + number of deposited layers); Layers can possibly be void (e.g. completely eroded), which is indicated by zero thickness. Time-dependent

field.name: elements
field.documentation: List of elements present in the solid phase in this layer. Vector (number of elements). Holds indices pointing to wall/elements

field.name: gases
field.documentation: List of gases present in this layer. Vector (number of gases). Holds indices pointing to wall/elements

field.name: compounds
field.documentation: List of compounds present in the solid phase in this layer. Vector (number of compounds). Holds indices pointing to wall/compounds

field.name: density
field.documentation: Discretized density distribution in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [kg/m^3]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: dx
field.documentation: Size of the vertical cells in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [kg/m^3]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: thickness
field.documentation: Total size of the layer [m] (i.e. sum of dx over the number of vertical cells in the layer); Time-dependent; Vector (number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: roughness
field.documentation: Interface roughness description between the discrete elements and their top neighbour (i.e. towards the plasma); Time-dependent; Float 3d array (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid, index of roughness parameter); Roughness parameter 1: RMS height [m], parameter 2: wavelength along projection of B on the surface [m], parameter 3: wavelength perpendicular to projection of B on the surface [m]. If only two parameters are given the parameters are assumed to be isotropic

field.name: porosity
field.documentation: Discrete description of porosity of the layer. Time-dependent; Float 3d array (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid, index of porosity parameter); Porosity parameter 1: Volume fraction occupied by the pores [-], parameter 2: average size of the pores [m]

field.name: dpa
field.documentation: Discretized number of displacements per atom in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [-]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: temperature
field.documentation: Discretized temperature distribution in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [eV]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: element_frac
field.documentation: Fractional abundance of elements in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [-]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of chemical elements as given in (local) elements, number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: chem_comp
field.documentation: Fractional abundance of chemical compounds in the layer of the discrete wall elements in the subgrid [-]; Time-dependent; Float matrix (number of chemical compounds as given in (local) compounds, number of vertical cells in layer, number of discretization elements in the subgrid)

field.name: bulk_D
field.documentation: Diffusivity of gas species in bulks of different compounds [m^2/s]; Time-dependent; 4d float array. Dimensions: 1. index of compound (indexing as in (local) compounds), 2. index of gas element (indexing as in (local) gases), 3. cell index of 1d layer height discretization, 4. number of discretization elements in the subgrid

field.name: surface_D
field.documentation: Diffusivity of hydrogen species of surface of different compounds [m^2/s]; Time-dependent; Dimensions: see bulk_D

field.name: bulk_solute
field.documentation: Bulk mobile (solute) concentration [atoms/m^3]; Time-dependent; Dimensions: see bulk_D

field.name: surf_solute
field.documentation: Surface mobile (solute) concentration [atoms/m^2]; Time-dependent; Dimensions: see bulk_D

field.name: pore_content
field.documentation: Amount of gas species trapped in pores per cubic meter [1/m^3]; Time-dependent; 3d float array. Dimensions: 1. index of gas element (indexing as in (local) gases), 2. cell index of 1d layer height discretization, 3. number of discretization element in the subgrid

field.name: trap_type
field.documentation: Definition of trap types. Array of structures (number of trap types)

field.name: trap_id
field.documentation: Identifier for the trap type

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: compound
field.documentation: Index of the compound doing the trapping. Refers to (local) ../compounds.

field.name: gas_species
field.documentation: Index of the gas species being trapped. Refers to (local) ../gases.

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Energy depth of the trap [eV]

field.name: fill_factor
field.documentation: Discretized filling fraction of traps in this layer (0...1) [-]. Dimensions: 1. index: cell index of depth discretization in this layer; 2. index: number of discretization elements in the subgrid

field.name: density
field.documentation: Discretized density of traps in this layer [1/m^3]. Dimensions: 1. index: cell index of depth discretization in this layer; 2. index: number of discretization elements in the subgrid

field.name: eta
field.documentation: Resitivity of wall element described by grid geometry [Ohm.m]

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: permeability
field.documentation: Relative permeability of wall element described by grid geometry [-]

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: j
field.documentation: Current density vector in the element specified by the grid representation. [A/m^2]

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this vector quantity is associated with.

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label describing the data

field.name: comp
field.documentation: Components of the vector. Array of structures (number of vector components). Time-dependent; FIXME: inherit time-dependence for this element

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: align
field.documentation: Alignment flag for vector components. Integer vector (number of vector components).

field.name: alignid
field.documentation: Alignment id for vector components. String vector (number of vector components).

field.name: basis
field.documentation: Index of basis (defined in associated grid) this vector is aligned to; If set to GRID_UNDEFINED=0, the canonical basis of the default coordinates of the grid assumed.

field.name: wall3d
field.documentation: 3D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, ...). Time-dependent

field.name: wall_id
field.documentation: Identify the type of wall - 0 for gas tight and 1 for a wall with holes/open ports

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Grid description

field.name: uid
field.documentation: Unique index of this grid. Used for handling multiple grids

field.name: id
field.documentation: Name / identifier string for this grid

field.name: spaces
field.documentation: Definitions of grid spaces. Array of structures (number of spaces)

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id flags). Flags defining how the geometry (objects.geo) fields associated with; space objects are to be interpreted. Array (number of geometries defined for this space),; first dimension: geometry index. A flag value of GRID_UNDEFINED=0 indicates the standard interpretation for; the given coordinates.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of space geometries (id string). See geotype.

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: objects
field.documentation: Definition of the space objects.; Array of structures (dimension of highest-dimensional objects).; First dimension: dimension of the objects (1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, ...)

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Lists of (n-1)-dimensional space objects defining the boundary of an n-dimensional space object.; Matrix(number of objects of dimension n, maximum number of boundary objects).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary object index

field.name: neighbour
field.documentation: Connectivity information. Array (number of objects, maximum number of boundaries per object, maximum number of neighbours per boundary).; Stores the indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object.;An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on every boundary.; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary index, third dimension: neighbour index on the boundary.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with every object. Float array (number of objects, number of geometry coeff. 1, number of geometry coeff. 2, number of geometries).; The exact definition depends on the geometry type of the space (complexgrid_space.geotype).; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: geometry coefficient matrix row+column, third dimension: geometry index (for definition of multiple geometries).

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of space objects, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...). [m^dim].; First dimension: object index, second dimension: geometry index

field.name: xpoints
field.documentation: List of indices of all nodes which are x-points. Vector (number of x-points)

field.name: subgrids
field.documentation: Definitions of subgrids. Array of structures (number of subgrids)

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID string (name) of the subgrid.

field.name: list
field.documentation: List of object lists. Array of structures (number of object lists).

field.name: cls
field.documentation: Class tuple of the grid objects in this object list. Vector (number of grid spaces)

field.name: indset
field.documentation: Implicit list of the object indices.; Array of structures (number of grid spaces = length of index tuple). Every index of the index tuple is described by an index set, which defines either a list of index values or a range of index values.

field.name: range
field.documentation: Defines an index range enumerating from range[1] to range[2] (with both range[1] and range[2] included). If additionally a third value range(3) is given, it is used as a stride. If it is omitted, a stride of 1 is assumed. Vector(3)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: An explicit list of indices. If this member is defined and has nonzero size, the list is assumed to be explicit. Vector(length of explicit index list)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: Explicit list of index tuples. Matrix (number of objects, number of spaces in grid).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: index tuple/space index.; If this field is defined and has nonzero size, the object list is understood to be explicit.

field.name: metric
field.documentation: Metric coefficients

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim].; Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.; Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.
